title: How are interchangeable pens when considering buying your first fountain pen? - Quora

response.answer_text: I assume you mean “interchangeable nibs.” It really depends on how important you think it will be to change nibs. I know that’s pretty hard to guess if this is your first pen, but it’s the truth. If you think you will want to try a few nibs, I’d encourage you to make your first pen a Lamy Safari. You can swap nibs quickly and easily and Lamy offers a nice variety at a good price. The Safari itself is under US$40 — not expensive as quality pens go, and designed for easy nib swaps. Even so, swapping nibs can be an inky business. Check YouTube for instructions on how to remove and insert a Lamy nib. Follow the instructions that involve cellophane tape. I don’t know of a better method for the Lamy. If you do plan on trying different nibs, please consider the 1.1 mm stub. You’ll be amazed at what it can do for your handwriting. That said, a huge number of vintage and new pens permit nib changes, but changing them without some instruction can be both difficult and hazardous to the life of the pen, not to mention your fingers and that brand-new shirt. Again, YouTube is your friend on this topic, where Brian Goulet, among others, does an exceptional job of teaching new pen owners just about everything they would need to know.
